= Questions

== Why is it important to use KUBECONFIG?

When you are logged into multiple clusters, it's important to be able to distinguish between those sessions.


== What does the following message indicate?

----
2020/06/05 13:10:09 deployments.apps "skupper-router" is forbidden: User "developer" cannot get resource "deployments" in API group "apps" in the namespace "west"
----

== What secrets are used?

----
apiVersion: v1
data:
  ca.crt: >-
    
  connect.json: >-
    
  tls.crt: >-
    
  tls.key: >-
    
kind: Secret
metadata:
  creationTimestamp: '2020-06-09T11:05:52Z'
  name: skupper
  namespace: west
  ownerReferences:
    - apiVersion: core/v1
      kind: ConfigMap
      name: skupper-site
      uid: 2dfa6af3-aa41-11ea-b6289-1210cb9989d89
  resourceVersion: '558963'
  selfLink: /api/v1/namespaces/west/secrets/skupper
  uid: 2eb598db-aa41-11ea-b6289-1210cb9989d89
type: kubernetes.io/tls

----

== Are connections one way?

Seems so, from one site it looks like you can see all the traffic.
From the other site, you cannot see this traffic.
